billgates: Bill gates was born on oct 28, 1955
As a teen at Lakeside Prep School, Bill Gates wrote his first computer program on a General Electric computer.It was a version of tic-tac-toe where you could play against the machine

Once his school discovered Gates' coding abilities, they let him write the school's computer program for scheduling students in classes. Gates slyly altered the code so he was placed in classes with a 'disproportionate number of interesting girls'
Bill Gates read the entire 'World Book Encyclopedia' series during his teenage years
Bill Gates was a college dropout
Two years after he dropped out of Harvard, Bill Gates was arrested in New Mexico
At Microsoft, Gates used to memorize employees' license plates to keep tabs on their comings and goings
Bill Gates doesn't know any foreign languages

values: Know thyself
The unexamined life is not worth living
Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent
I think therefore I am
He who thinks great thoughts, often makes great errors
We live in the best of all possible worlds
To be is to be perceived
Only one man ever understood me, and he didn’t understand me
Life must be understood backward. But it must be lived forward
Science is what you know. Philosophy is what you don't know
You can discover more about a person in an hour of play than in a year of conversation
I would never die for my beliefs because I might be wrong
The only thing I know is that I know nothing
Be the change that you wish to see in the world
Without music, life would be a mistake
May you live every day of your life
We have to dare to be ourselves, however frightening or strange that self may prove to be
Trust yourself. You know more than you think you do
If you ever find yourself in the wrong story, leave
I will not say 'do not weep,' for not all tears are an evil
All we have to do is decide what to do with the time that is given to us
you have the chance to become part of something much bigger than yourself
Not all those who wander are lost
may the force be with you
Don’t call me a mindless philosopher, you overweight glob of grease
